data.enText: slow movement

data.chText: 流动；趋势；逐渐变化（尤指向坏的方面）
data.enText: a slow steady movement from one place to another; a gradual change or development from one situation to another, especially to sth bad
a population drift away from rural areas

data.chText: 制止逐步走上战争道路的努力
data.enText: attempts to halt the drift towards war
of ship
the movement of a ship or plane away from its direction because of currents or wind
of sea/air
the movement of the sea or air

data.chText: 东海岸海水的总体流向
data.enText: the general direction of drift on the east coast

data.chText: 他对那段河道中的暗流非常清楚。
data.enText: He knew the hidden drifts in that part of the river.
of snow
a large pile of sth, especially snow, made by the wind

data.chText: 道路被风吹来的厚厚积雪阻塞。
data.enText: The road was blocked by deep drifts of snow.
of flowers
a large mass of sth, especially flowers
Plant daffodils in informal drifts.
meaning
the general meaning of what sb says or writes
Do you catch my drift ?

data.chText: 我的德语不太好，但我大致明白她说的意思。
data.enText: My German isn't very good, but I got the drift of what she said.
move slowly
to move along smoothly and slowly in water or air
Clouds drifted across the sky.
The empty boat drifted out to sea.
to move or go somewhere slowly

data.chText: 人群渐渐从事故现场散去。
data.enText: The crowd drifted away from the scene of the accident.

data.chText: 她用目光缓缓扫视了一下室内。
data.enText: Her gaze drifted around the room.
without purpose

data.chText: 无意间发生；无目的地转变；顺其自然地做
data.enText: to happen or change, or to do sth without a particular plan or purpose

data.chText: 我并没想过当老师——只是顺其自然就当了。
data.enText: I didn't intend to be a teacher─I just drifted into it.

data.chText: 他还没决定做什么——只是顺其自然。
data.enText: He hasn't decided what to do yet─he's just drifting.

data.chText: 谈话不知不觉就转到政治方面来了。
data.enText: The conversation drifted onto politics.
into state/situation

data.chText: 无意间进入；不知不觉陷入
data.enText: to go from one situation or state to another without realizing it

data.chText: 最后她不知不觉地睡着了。
data.enText: Finally she drifted into sleep.

data.chText: 受伤的男人想说点什么，但一会儿就不省人事了。
data.enText: The injured man tried to speak but soon drifted into unconsciousness.
of snow/sand
to be blown into large piles by the wind
drifting sand

data.chText: 有些道路因积雪而封闭。
data.enText: Some roads are closed because of drifting.
float
to make sth float somewhere

data.chText: 原木顺流漂到木材加工厂。
data.enText: The logs are drifted downstream to the mill.
drift apart
to become less friendly or close to sb

data.chText: 孩提时我们亲密无间，但随着年龄的增长我们就逐渐疏远了。
data.enText: As children we were very close, but as we grew up we just drifted apart.
drift off (to sleep)
to fall asleep

data.chText: 我没有听见暴风雨，那时一定是睡着了。
data.enText: I didn't hear the storm. I must have drifted off by then.

means: 逐渐变化(尤指向坏的方面)

ex.chText: 这个小男孩很想弄清楚为什么那只木筏能浮起来。
ex.enText: The little boy was wondering why the raft could float.
Clouds are floating in the sky.
There isn't enough water to float the ship.

ex.chText: 她的声音从楼上飘下来。
ex.enText: Her voice came floating down from upstairs.

synonyms.bx: 指因有液体或气体的支撑而不沉，表示动态或静态，可用于形容具体事物或声音、气味等抽象事物。

ex.enText: The boat drifted out to sea.
Falling leaves drifted by her window.

synonyms.bx: 指随风或顺水缓慢移动，强调动态，常用于形容具体事物。

data.enText: drift apart
to become less friendly or close to sb

data.chText: 孩提时我们亲密无间，但随着年龄的增长我们就逐渐疏远了。
data.enText: As children we were very close, but as we grew up we just drifted apart.
drift off (to sleep)
to fall asleep

data.chText: 我没有听见暴风雨，那时一定是睡着了。
data.enText: I didn't hear the storm. I must have drifted off by then.

trans: 迷迷糊糊地睡去；逐渐入睡

tr: a horizontal (or nearly horizontal) passageway in a mine
example: they dug a drift parallel with the vein
caught the general drift of the conversation

tr: a general tendency to change (as of opinion)
example: not openly liberal but that is the trend of the book
a broad movement of the electorate to the right

tr: a large mass of material that is heaped up by the wind or by water currents
a force that moves something along
the gradual departure from an intended course due to external influences (as a ship or plane)
a process of linguistic change over a period of time
be piled up in banks or heaps by the force of wind or a current
example: snow drifting several feet high
sand drifting like snow
The stock market drifted upward

tr: drive slowly and far afield for grazing
example: drift the cattle herds westwards

tr: cause to be carried by a current
example: drift the boats downstream

tr: move about aimlessly or without any destination, often in search of food or employment
example: The gypsies roamed the woods
roving vagabonds
the wandering Jew
The cattle roam across the prairie
the laborers drift from one town to the next
They rolled from town to town

tr: be in motion due to some air or water current
example: The leaves were blowing in the wind
the boat drifted on the lake
The sailboat was adrift on the open sea
the shipwrecked boat drifted away from the shore
The unknown young man drifted among the invited guests

tr: wander from a direct course or at random
example: The child strayed from the path and her parents lost sight of her
don't drift from the set course
My son drifted around for years in California before going to law school

tr: vary or move from a fixed point or course
example: stock prices are drifting higher

value.def: When something drifts somewhere, it is carried there by the movement of wind or water.

example.ex: We proceeded to drift on up the river...
example.tran: 我们继续向河流的上游漂流。

example.ex: The climbing balloon drifted silently over the countryside...
example.tran: 不断上升的气球静静地飘过乡间。

example.ex: The waves became rougher as they drifted.
example.tran: 他们漂流的时候,波浪越来越汹涌了。

value.def: If someone or something drifts into a situation, they get into that situation in a way that is not planned or controlled.

example.ex: We need to offer young people drifting into crime an alternative set of values...
example.tran: 我们需要给那些无意间犯了罪的年轻人灌输另一套价值观。

example.ex: She and her husband drifted apart and, eventually, they divorced...
example.tran: 她和她丈夫渐行渐远,最后他们离婚了。

example.ex: There is a general sense that the country and economy alike are drifting.
example.tran: 大家普遍感觉国家和经济都脱离了正轨。

value.tran: 无意间进入;不知不觉陷入

value.def: If you say that someone drifts around, you mean that they travel from place to place without a plan or settled way of life.

example.ex: You've been drifting from job to job without any real commitment.
example.tran: 你一直在无目的地更换工作，从未真正投入进去。

value.def: A drift is a movement away from somewhere or something, or a movement towards somewhere or something different.
value.tran: 移动;动向;趋势;逐渐变化

value.def: To drift somewhere means to move there slowly or gradually.

example.ex: As rural factories shed labour, people drift towards the cities.
example.tran: 由于农村的工厂纷纷裁员,人们逐渐流向城市。

value.def: If sounds drift somewhere, they can be heard but they are not very loud.

example.ex: Cool summer dance sounds are drifting from the stereo indoors.
example.tran: 清凉的夏日舞曲的声音从室内音响中传了出来。

value.def: If snow drifts, it builds up into piles as a result of the movement of the wind.

example.ex: The snow, except where it drifted, was only calf-deep...
example.tran: 除了吹得堆积起来的地方,雪只有小腿肚深。
暴风雪造成了严重的积雪现象。

value.def: A drift is a mass of snow that has built up into a pile as a result of the movement of wind.
A drift of something is an amount of it that has been created by the movement of wind or water.

example.ex: There was a drift of smoke above the trees.
example.tran: 树林上空飘浮着一股烟。

value.def: The drift of an argument or speech is the general point that is being made in it.

example.ex: Grace was beginning to get his drift...
example.tran: 格雷丝慢慢明白了他的意思。

example.ex: Anybody who's listening will get the drift of what he was saying...
example.tran: 任何一个在专心听的人都会领悟他所说的大意。

example.ex: I follow the drift of her conversation.

trans: 温度漂移；温度频差；温漂；溫度漂移；温度变化
零点漂移；零漂；零漂移；零点偏移；零點漂移
慢慢向前漂（飘）；游荡，混日子
慢慢飘（走），逐渐离去；开始用不同的方式思考或感觉
漂移管；有电子漂移空间的电子管；通风管
分开；疏远；各奔东西；逐渐疏远
逐渐入睡；迷迷糊糊地睡去
